History of the Catholic Worker Movement

The Catholic Worker Movement by Jim Forest
A short account of the movements founding and principle ideas by a friend and biographer of Dorothy Day.
A Brief Introduction to the Catholic Worker Movement by Tom Cornell
An essay written by long-time Catholic Worker Tom Cornell which includes biographical sketches of Peter Maurin and Dorothy Day, as well as highlights of the Movement's history, religious and philosophical ideas.
